title: Remove the !Send and !Sync impls for proc_macro::LineColumn

labels.name: C-enhancement
labels.description: Category: An issue proposing an enhancement or a PR with one.

labels.name: A-macros
labels.description: Area: All kinds of macros (custom derive, macro_rules!, proc macros, ..)

labels.name: T-libs-api
labels.description: Relevant to the library API team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
https://doc.rust-lang.org/1.30.0/proc_macro/struct.LineColumn.html

https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/ca79ecd6940e30d4b2466bf378632efcdf5745c7/src/libproc_macro/lib.rs#L396-L404

https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/ca79ecd6940e30d4b2466bf378632efcdf5745c7/src/libproc_macro/lib.rs#L406-L409

This struct consists of two public fields. It holds a line number and a column number. Given that all the fields are public, no additional private state could be added here backward compatibly in the future. As such, it should be fine for this type to be Send and Sync.

This came up because in proc-macro2 there is no way for us to opt out of auto traits for such a struct in a way that supports current stable Rust.

@eddyb this type has no private state so I assume it is the exception you had in mind in https://github.com/alexcrichton/proc-macro2/issues/141#issuecomment-434876734.
